\def \articleTITLE{[Re] Reproduction of Step width enhancement in a pulse-driven Josephson junction}
\def \articleTYPE{Replication}
\def \articleDOMAIN{Physics}
\def \articleBIBLIOGRAPHY{bibliography.bib}
\def \articleYEAR{2020}
\def \reviewURL{}
\def \articleABSTRACT{When I read about the Ten Years Challenge, it was a matter of seconds to take the plunge and decide to partecipate with the replication of a work on the numerical simulation of a Josephson junction driven by a train of microwave pulses. The experience has been exceptionally interesting and all considered much easier than I initially thought. The paper describes the tools and tricks used for the replication and the lessons learned from this work. Among them, keeping good and updated documentation is paramount. Likewise, the use of tools and languages that do not fall into oblivion after one or two iterations.}
